text:
Sixth Avenue, from W. 50th to 5lst Streets. View No. 1 is south from 5lst Street and shows the old carbarn on the west side of this frontage. This was demolished. The site provides a vantage polnt for the additional views. There the view point is respectively southeast and north east; the station being at 50th St. Beyond same is the future Rockefeller Center site. Under construction is the Grand Central Building.
October 22, 1927
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr

Sixth Avenue, from W. 50th to 5lst Streets. View No. 1 is south from 5lst Street and shows the old carbarn on the west side of this frontage. This was demolished. The site provides a vantage polnt for the additional views. Sixth Avenue, from W. 50th to 5lst Streets. View No. 1 is south from 5lst Street and shows the old carbarn on the west side of this frontage. This was demolished. West 50th Street, north side, east from a point midway between Seventh and Sixth AveS., and across the latter. Shown under demolition is the southeastern corner of the New York Railways Company plant and barn which occupied the entire block. The low structures east of Sixth Ave. (Elevated station thereon) have gone and today (1937),units of Radio City stand thereon. Note the twin spires of St. Patricks Cathedral in the background. This set consists of a negative and a positive.
March 23, 1928.
F. M. Demarest.
Cnift of Albert A. Volk Co.

50th Street, east from but not including Sixth Ave.
September 28, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

South on Sixth Avenue from roof between 50th and 51st Street.
September 14, 1931.
P.L.Sperr,Photographer.

Sixth Avenue, east side, from W. 50th to 51st Streets, showing the Rockefeller Center excavation. Upon this portion of the same will rise the 31 story R. K. O. Building and its adjoining 8 story International Music Hall. The northbound platform of the 50th Street station of the Sixth Ave. "El" is in the foreground. The photographer is viewing eastward across the same from atop a building on the west side of the Avenue.
September 14, 1931.
Views 1, 2, 3
P. L. Sperr

Sixth Avenue, east side, from W. 50th to 51st Streets, showing the Rockefeller Center excavation. Upon this portion of the same will rise the 31 story R. K. O. Building and its adjoining 8 story International Music Hall. The northbound platform of the 50th Street station of the Sixth Ave. "El" is in the foreground. The photographer is viewing eastward across the same from atop a building on the west side of the Avenue.

Views 1, 2, 3

The photographer is viewing eastward across the same from atop a building on the west side of the Avenue.
September 14, 1931.
Views 1, 2, 3
P. L. Sperr

Sixth Avenue, east side, at West 50th Street (center of View 1) showing the Rockefeller Center clearance that extends from 48th to 5lst Streets. The photographer is viewing eastward from atop a building on the west side of the Avenue. Fifth Avenue forms the distant edge of this huge building site.
September 14, 1931
P. L. Sperr  Views 1,2

Sixth Avenue, east side, at West 50th Street (center of View 1) showing the Rockefeller Center clearance that extends from 48th to 5lst Streets. The photographer is viewing eastward from atop a building on the west side of the Avenue. Fifth Avenue forms the distant edge of this huge building site.
September 14, 1931
P. L. Sperr  Views 1,2

50th Street, east from but not including Sixth Ave. The View shows Fifth Ave, east side, from 49th to 50th Streets, and 49th Street, from and including Fifth Ave, east to but not including Madison Ave. In the foreground is seen the excavation for one of
the Radio City buildings.
March 18, 1932.
P.L. Sperr.
The same, showing only the south side of 50th Street, eastward. Note the unfinished tower of the Waldorf Astoria Hotel.
June 28, 1931.

(1)  1260-1272 Sixth Ave., east side, between West 50th and 51st Streets. This is the site of the R.K.O. Building, which is shown in this view in the process of construction. Photographers viewpoint was from 10 West
49th Street, northward.
Vanuary 24, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(2) The same, as seen from the doorway at Nos. 42-46 West 48th Street.
February 14, 1932.
P. L Sperr.
(3)
The completed 31-story R.K.0. Building. The low 8-story astructure at its rear is the Ihuternational Music Hall. Note Sixth Ave. cutting a diagonal across the face otr the view and the 50th Street station of
its elevated line.
August 9, 1933.
P. L. 'rerr.

144-136 West 50th Street, south side, between Seventh and Sixth
Aves.
March 20, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

West 50th Street, north side, between Sixth and Seventh Aves., showing the automobile parking space, as it extends northward to West 52nd, after crossing West 51st Streets. In the background (left to right) appear the 45-story Essex House, the 36-story Hampshire House, and the 40-story Barbison-Plasa, respectively, Nos. 160 and 170, 150, and 106 Central
Park South, between Seventh and Sixth Aves.
March 30, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

W. EOth Sreet, east from a point to the west of Sixth Svenue and showing units of Roclefeller City, beyond a station of the Sixth Avenue Elevated Line. The 7O storied R.C.A. Building is to the richt and to the left, Radio City Music Pall. At this date subway construction is proceeding as eviden ced by the detail shown at the corners. In February 1939 the
"E" will be removed.
May 3, 1938.
P.L. Sperr

folder: Sixth Avenue - West 50th Street, Manhattan, NY
title: Sixth Avenue - West 50th Street

text:
Sixth Avenue, at West 50th Street, showing the tracks and the uptown station of the "El", prior to demolition. These photographs are taken from the downtown platform and feature
the opposite side.

Buildings forming the background are on the east side of this thoroughfare and extend northward. The Radio City Music Hall is in the R.K.O. Building which occupies the 50th-51st Street frontage. View No.2 shows a train of wooden cars making
its last run uptown.

March, 1939
Views: 1-2

Wm.  Herries

Sixth Avenue, at West 50th Street, showing the tracks and the uptown station of the "El", prior to demolition. These photographs are taken from the downtown platform and feature
the opposite side.

Buildings forming the background are on the east side of this thoroughfare and extend northward. The Radio City Music Hall is in the R.K.O. Building which occupies the 50th-51st Street frontage. View No.2 shows a train of wooden cars making
its last run uptown.

March, 1939
Views: 1-2

Wm.  Herries
